posts.post_content:
Thanks, Jeff, for your Midas touch.

Not slabbed. If I were a betting man, I'd say this probably would receive a 1.5. Though it doesn't have the corners of a 9 (!) and it's not terribly undergraded (because, after all, I graded it), I will say the card looks better in hand than it does in the huge scans below.

[STRIKE]$115[/STRIKE] $114 delivered. Shipping to United States only. Check, money order or PayPal in U.S. dollars.

Thanks, Rob

wolfie51sb at aol.com

I'm always suspicious of cards when the front is larger than the back.;)

But I'd give it a 2.
So it is severely undergraded. (I thought it might have the corners of a 2.) Thanks, Frank.

Frank, I don't know who you are (and vice versa) but you have the weirdest, funniest, quirkiest sense of humor. And I'm the same exact way.  No matter what you are commenting on, I always try to read it.  You crack me up with every post!!
Rob, how did you post those scans without my help? What gives?
One bump before I send it off to SGC, relist it in a holder and claim that it's severely undergraded. Please don't make me do that.

Rob,
Maybe in a PSA holder the owner of a top 5 t206 collection would buy. Food for thought.

[quote name="Mikehealer" post=1082033]Rob,
Maybe in a PSA holder the owner of a top 5 t206 collection would buy. Food for thought.[/QUOTE]

It did cross my mind that while this card probably would end up a 7 in an SGC holder, the best I could hope for with PSA is a 1.5.

If that.
Good thinking, I don't usually think that far ahead.

i see a bump, but not a[STRIKE] 5%[/STRIKE]2.5% price drop.  that's not right they belong together!  you monster...

edit: edit.

[quote name="chaddurbin" post=1082072]i see a bump, but not a[STRIKE] 5%[/STRIKE]2.5% price drop.  that's not right they belong together!  you monster...

edit: edit.[/QUOTE]

Bump for price reduction to $114 delivered.
Bump, as I know Rob likes to sleep late on Saturday.
